page.title: 02KENT UNIVERSITY RESEARCH
page.content: FIRST INFRA-RED SIGHTING OF COMET HALLEY. Dr.John Zarnecki of Kent's Space SciencesLaboratory has recently been involved in a unique observation of Halley's Comet.It was the first time that this singular,'once-in-a-lifetime' comet has ever been detected by the infra red rather than the visible light it emits,and the first observation for over 73 years carried out by a British astronomer of a comet named after one of Britain's most famous astronomers. The particular interest that the University has in this heavenly body stems from the experiment that its Space Sciences Laboratory is building for the European Space Agency's Halley encounter mission,named GIOTTO.
